title: Air Canada Ends Strike with Tentative Deal, Flights to Resume Tuesday
snippets: The flight attendants' union said a new agreement guarantees members will be paid for work performed while planes are on the ground, resolving one of the major issues that drove the strike.
While details of the agreement are not clear, the flight attendant union said that 'unpaid work is over'.
Air Canada is set to "gradually resume service" after reaching a "tentative" agreement to end a flight attendants' strike. Staff had been on strike since Saturday over pay and unpaid work.

Strike over wages and ground work has cancelled travel for 500,000 people worldwide

Air Canada flight attendants say they have reached a “tentative” deal with the airline to end a strike over wages and ground work that has cancelled travel for half a million people worldwide.

Roughly
Air Canada flights will resume Tuesday evening, it said. Details were sparse on the tentative deal between the company and its flight attendants union, CUPE.

Air Canada flights are back in the air after attendants and the airline reached a tentative agreement earlier Tuesday. The union representing Air Canada’s 10,000 flight attendants confirmed its members would return to work, ending a disruptive strike that grounded thousands of flights and stra
titles: Air Canada flights slowly resume after flight attendants agree to end their strike
Air Canada to resume operations after cabin crew strike ends
Air Canada to resume service after 'tentative' agreement
Air Canada flight attendants reach ‘tentative’ deal with airline to end strike
Air Canada to resume flights after making deal to end cabin crew strike
Strike over: Air Canada flights resume after attendants, airline reach tentative agreement
summary: Air Canada and its flight attendants' union have reached a tentative agreement, ending a strike that began on Saturday over wages and unpaid ground work. The strike, which affected 500,000 travelers worldwide, led to the grounding of thousands of flights. The new deal ensures that flight attendants will be paid for work performed on the ground, addressing a key grievance. Flights are set to resume Tuesday evening, though specific details of the agreement remain undisclosed.

title: Julio César Chávez Jr. Deported to Mexico, Faces Crime Charges
snippets: Julio César Chávez Jr., 39, arrested days after his fight with Jake Paul, has been deported to Mexico, where he's wanted for alleged cartel ties, following his detention in the U.S. for allegedly overstaying his visa and lying on a green card application.
Chávez was deported to Mexico on charges of cartel involvement, including arms and drug trafficking
Julio César Chávez Jr., son of the legendary Mexican boxer, has been deported to Mexico, where authorities say he faces charges of organized crime affiliation and arms trafficking.
titles: Chávez deported to Mexico for alleged cartel ties
Former champion Julio César Chávez Jr. deported to Mexico, jailed after ICE arrest in Los Angeles
Boxer Julio César Chávez Jr. deported to Mexico
summary: Julio César Chávez Jr., 39, was deported to Mexico after being detained in the U.S. for visa issues and allegedly lying on a green card application. In Mexico, he faces charges related to organized crime, including arms and drug trafficking. This legal action follows shortly after his fight with Jake Paul.

title: FDA Warns Against Radioactive Shrimp at Walmart
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigAFBVV95cUxONnpYWGhSNEpCYXlnblVRVm9ZWkZCbUFudk1SbU9taEpYLXc4NnhtTlhhREd2SkNGRDdrZHJ0bXhlMkV0VC1semFXazBuT3BaS3dUNjd0QjE4MWJCMzYtaWMxSUZaV0NrSGF2VDFQOHRVVjV3MDFrX1BqZzh2Y3JaSw?oc=5" target="_blank">FDA warns public about eating radioactive shrimp from
The FDA warns that a shipment of frozen shrimp meant for Walmart tested positive for radioactive poisoning.
Federal officials detected Cesium-137, a radioactive isotope, in shipping containers and a sample of breaded shrimp imported from Indonesia.
titles: FDA warns public about eating radioactive shrimp from Walmart - Axios
Please let me eat the radioactive shrimp from Walmart
Walmart recalls potentially radioactive frozen shrimp sold in 13 states
summary: The FDA has issued a warning against consuming a batch of frozen shrimp sold at Walmart, found to be contaminated with Cesium-137, a radioactive isotope. The contamination was detected in shipping containers and a sample of breaded shrimp imported from Indonesia.

title: Raducanu and Alcaraz Exit US Open Mixed Doubles in First Round
snippets: Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz might have lost in the revamped US Open mixed doubles - but they win the hearts of the New York crowd.

After many long months of discussion and anticipation, the doubles partnership between Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz came and went in the blink of an eye in a well‑populated Arth

Jack Draper won the battle of the British No 1s as he and playing partner Jessica Pegula beat Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz in the first round of the US Open's revamped, star-studded mixed doubles competition.

summary: Emma Raducanu and Carlos Alcaraz, despite being a highly anticipated duo, were eliminated in the first round of the US Open's revamped mixed doubles competition. They faced defeat against Jack Draper and Jessica Pegula. However, their participation and the event's star-studded lineup captivated the New York crowd, highlighting the mixed fortunes in the tournament's new format.

title: Salah Wins PFA Player of the Year for Record Third Time; Caldentey Honored
snippets: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah wins the Professional Footballers' Association men's player of the year award, with Aston Villa midfielder Morgan Rogers named young player of the year.
Arsenal midfielder Mariona Caldentey is named the Professional Footballers' Association women's player of the year as her new team-mate Olivia Smith wins the young player award.

• Liverpool forward wins honour for the third time

  • Caldentey award follows stellar season for Arsenal

Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah and Arsenal’s Mariona Caldentey have won the 2025 awards for the Professional Footballers’ Association players’ player of the year.<
Liverpool star Mohamed Salah has won a record third PFA men's Player of the Year award, with Arsenal's Mariona Caldentey collecting the women's accolade.
titles: Salah and Rogers scoop PFA player of the year awards
Caldentey and Smith win PFA player of the year awards
Prolific Salah and Caldentey rewarded with PFA player of the year awards
Salah, Caldentey scoop 2024/25 PFA Player of the Year awards
summary: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah won the Professional Footballers' Association men's Player of the Year award for a record third time. Aston Villa's Morgan Rogers was named young player of the year. On the women's side, Arsenal's Mariona Caldentey received the Player of the Year award, with teammate Olivia Smith securing the young player award. These accolades follow exceptional seasons for both Salah and Caldentey with their respective clubs.

title: UK Withdraws Request for Apple Data Access After US Talks
snippets: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard said the British government order “would have enabled access to the protected encrypted data of American citizens.”

Tulsi Gabbbard says Home Office no longer demanding ‘backdoor’ to encrypted material

The UK government has dropped its insistence that Apple allows law enforcement officials “backdoor” access to US customer data, Donald Trump’s spy chief, Tulsi Gabbard, says.

The US director of nation
Tulsi Gabbard said that President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance also participated in the negotiations with the U.K. government over its once-secret demand to Apple.
titles: U.K. drops ‘back door’ demand for Apple user data, U.S. intel chief says
UK has backed down on demand to access US Apple user data, spy chief says
US spy chief says UK has dropped its Apple backdoor demand
summary: The UK government has withdrawn its request for Apple to provide "backdoor" access to encrypted data of US users, according to Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard. This decision, which Gabbard says upholds the privacy of US citizens, came after negotiations involving President Donald Trump and Vice President JD Vance. The initial demand by the UK's Home Office was aimed at allowing law enforcement access to encrypted material, a move now reversed in favor of user privacy.

title: Canadian Military Probes Soldiers in Video with Nazi Salutes
snippets: The commander of the Canadian Army, Lt.-Gen. Michael Wright, called the video's contents disturbing and said that hate and extremism "have no place" in the Canadian Armed Forces.

The Canadian Military Police is investigating after a 2023 video emerged that they say shows five serving members at an event where other individuals performed a Nazi salute. The members are Quebec-based. “On August 6, 2025, I was notified of a video containing hateful conduct involving member
titles: 5 Canadian military members suspended over video showing Nazi salute
Quebec-based Canadian soldiers suspended after 2023 video that shows others making Nazi salute
summary: The Canadian Military Police are investigating a 2023 video showing five Quebec-based Canadian Armed Forces members at an event where Nazi salutes were performed by others. Lt.-Gen. Michael Wright, the commander of the Canadian Army, condemned the video's contents as disturbing and stated that hate and extremism are unacceptable within the forces. The investigation was announced on August 6, 2025, emphasizing the military's stance against such behavior.

title: Sophie Cunningham Out for 2025 WNBA Season with Knee Injury

title: Rory McIlroy Buys 1,100 Masters Flags to Celebrate Augusta Win
snippets: Rory McIlroy said he took all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop after winning at Augusta National in April. "I've waited 17 years to sign that flag in the middle, and I will never complain about doing it."
McIlroy said he will 'never get sick' of signing flags to commemorate his Masters win
titles: Rory: Took home 1,100 Masters flags after win
Rory McIlroy says he took home 1,100 pin flags from The Masters Shop after completing career grand slam
summary: After winning the Masters at Augusta National in April, Rory McIlroy acquired all 1,100 pin flags from the Masters Shop, expressing his deep appreciation for the victory. He highlighted the significance of the win by stating his eagerness to sign the flags, a task he views as a privilege rather than a burden, despite the large number. McIlroy's comments reflect his fulfillment and pride in achieving a long-awaited milestone in his golfing career.

title: Nvidia Strikes Deal with U.S. to Sell AI Chips in China, Offers Govt 15% Share
snippets: Nvidia last week struck a deal with the U.S. government to resume selling products in China, in exchange for giving it a 15% cut of the sales.

Nvidia is apparently putting together a new AI chip meant for sale in China that's half as powerful as its flagship B300 Blackwell GPU. The new chip would be more powerful than the H20 GPUs the company is currently allowed to sell in the country.
titles: Nvidia says it's evaluating a 'variety of products' after report of new AI chip for China
Nvidia said to be developing new, more powerful AI chip for sale in China
summary: Nvidia has reached an agreement with the U.S. government to continue its sales in China, offering the government a 15% share of these sales. As part of this deal, Nvidia is developing a new AI chip for the Chinese market, which will be half as powerful as its leading B300 Blackwell GPU but still surpasses the capabilities of the H20 GPUs currently permitted for sale in China.

title: NASA's Webb Telescope Discovers New Moon Around Uranus
snippets: The James Webb Space Telescope has discovered a new moon that is small and dim in orbit around Uranus. The discovery brings the planet's total to 29, and scientists say there are probably more to be found

Using NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, a team led by the Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) has identified a previously unknown moon orbiting Uranus, expanding the planet's known satellite family to 29. The detection was made during a Webb observation on Feb. 2, 2025.
titles: New moon discovered orbiting Uranus is its smallest one
Webb discovers a new moon orbiting Uranus
summary: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, operated by a team from the Southwest Research Institute, discovered a new moon orbiting Uranus on February 2, 2025. This discovery increases Uranus's total number of known moons to 29. Scientists believe there may be more moons yet to be found around the planet.

title: Nexstar Proposes $6.2B Deal for Tegna, Awaits FCC Review
snippets: Nextstar is looking to buy Tegna in a $6.2 billion cash deal — but will the FCC allow it despite a conflict with current TV ownership rules?
titles: Nexstar-Tegna deal puts Trump move to eliminate broadcast ownership rules to the test
summary: Nexstar has proposed a $6.2 billion cash deal to acquire Tegna, a transaction that is under scrutiny due to potential conflicts with existing TV ownership regulations. The deal's approval is contingent on the Federal Communications Commission's (FCC) review to determine if it aligns with or violates these rules. The current status of the acquisition is pending FCC's decision.

title: Study Finds School Menstruation Education Lacks Depth
snippets: Teaching about periods in schools is still too focused on basic biological facts, with insufficient information around how menstruation can affect a woman's mood and well-being, problems associated with menstrual bleeding, and their impact on physical and academic performance, concludes a new study
titles: Boys can help break taboo around periods
summary: A new study concludes that education on menstruation in schools is overly focused on basic biology, lacking comprehensive information on its effects on mood, well-being, and the potential for menstrual problems to impact physical and academic performance.

title: AI Detects Rare Double-Glow Supernova, Advances Astrophysics Insights
titles: AI Captures Once-in-a-Lifetime Supernova That Glowed Twice
summary: An AI system captured a rare astronomical event: a supernova that exhibited a unique double glow. This phenomenon, where a star explosively dies and then brightens again, was identified with the help of artificial intelligence, marking a significant achievement in the field of astrophysics. This discovery provides valuable insights into the life cycle of stars and the dynamics of supernovae.

title: Bonobo's Hide-and-Seek Game Shows Apes Can Track Multiple Humans Mentally
snippets: A series of hide-and-seek experiments with a bonobo named Kanzi shows for the first time that apes can mentally keep track of multiple familiar humans at once, even when they are out of sight.
titles: For apes, out of sight isn't out of mind: Bonobos can mentally track multiple members of their social circle
summary: Hide-and-seek experiments with a bonobo named Kanzi demonstrated that apes have the ability to mentally track the location of multiple familiar humans simultaneously, even when those humans are not visible. This marks the first time such cognitive skills have been observed in apes.

title: NASA's Space Mission Advances with Successful Data Downlink
snippets: Written by Lucy Thompson, Planetary Scientist and APXS Team Member, University of New Brunswick, Canada Earth Planning Date: Monday, Aug. 18, 2025 The downlink data from our weekend activities arrived on Earth as we started planning this morning. As the APXS payload uplink and downlink lead, I asses

Written by Remington Free, Operations Systems Engineer at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory Earth planning date: Friday, Aug. 15, 2025 Today we uplinked a three-sol weekend plan with lots of exciting activities — to support both the science and engineering teams!  While usually our science activities
titles: Curiosity Blog, Sols 4634-4635: A Waiting Game
Curiosity Blog, Sols 4631-4633: Radiant Ridge Revolution
summary: On August 15, 2025, NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory uplinked a three-sol weekend plan filled with activities aimed at supporting both the science and engineering teams of a space mission. Following this, on August 18, 2025, Lucy Thompson, a Planetary Scientist and APXS Team Member from the University of New Brunswick, Canada, reported the successful arrival of downlink data from these weekend activities. The data arrival marked the beginning of a new planning phase, indicating progress in the mission's operations and research objectives.

title: James Webb Telescope Captures Planet Birthplace in NGC 6357 Nebula
titles: James Webb Spots Birthplace of Planets in Extreme Ultraviolet Conditions
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has observed the birthplace of planets within the NGC 6357 Nebula, capturing images in extreme ultraviolet conditions. This marks a significant advancement in understanding the conditions and processes that lead to planet formation.

title: Top pediatricians buck RFK Jr.’s anti-vaccine meddling on COVID shot guidance
snippets: The American Academy of Pediatrics recommends children under age 2 get vaccinated.
titles: Top pediatricians buck RFK Jr.’s anti-vaccine meddling on COVID shot guidance

title: Cell Culture Medium: Crucial for Growth in Multiple Industries
snippets: Cell culture is a foundational technology widely used across fields such as pharmaceutical production, regenerative medicine, food science, and materials engineering. A critical component of successful cell culture is the culture medium—a solution containing essential nutrients that support cell gro
titles: AI learns biological variability to develop a high-performance serum-free culture medium
summary: Cell culture, a key technology in pharmaceuticals, regenerative medicine, food science, and materials engineering, relies on a culture medium to grow. This solution provides the essential nutrients needed for cell growth, highlighting its importance in various scientific and industrial applications.

title: Fallout S2 teaser brings us to New Vegas
snippets: Justin Theroux joins the cast as the villainous Robert House, along with a live-action Deathclaw.
titles: Fallout S2 teaser brings us to New Vegas

They declared the area a "Liberated Zone" encampment and said they had changed its name from
titles: Microsoft employees occupy headquarters in protest of Israel contracts

snippets: Claude support in Xcode heralds bigger moves across the ecosystem.
titles: In Xcode 26, Apple shows first signs of offering ChatGPT alternatives

title: Webb Telescope Discovers Potential Birthplaces of Universe's First Black Holes
titles: Webb’s Mysterious “Little Red Dots” May Be the Cradle of the First Black Holes
summary: The James Webb Space Telescope has identified mysterious "little red dots" in space, which astronomers believe could be the birthplaces of the universe's first black holes. This discovery provides new insights into the origins of black holes and the early universe.
